intro: Chrysopsis oregona, commonly known as the Oregon sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, dandelions, and other sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow ray flowers and a central disk of smaller florets. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Chrysopsis oregona is well adapted to arid environments and is often found in regions with full sun exposure.
